title: Turn Up the Savings: Our 2025 Guide to Killer Wireless Earbuds Under $100
description: Flagship earbuds like Apple's AirPods Pro, Sony's WF‑1000XM5, Jabra's Elite 10, and Soundcore's Liberty 4 Pro sound fantastic, but they come with equally premium price tags. Luckily, there are plenty of stellar alternatives that won't gut your wallet. Spend less than $100, and you can still land punchy audio, rock‑solid active noise canceling (ANC), and marathon battery life without feeling like you settled. Below, we start with our overall winner and count down to number five, covering specs, pros and cons, and the exclusive, standout features that separate each pair from the pack. Each model stands out for different strengths, so you can zero in on the perfect balance of price and performance without sacrificing the features that matter most to you. Quick notesBefore diving in, here are a few cross‑model facts and caveats to keep in mind: iPhone codec limits: iOS maxes out at AAC, so LDAC (Lossless Digital Audio Codec), aptX Adaptive/Lossless, and Snapdragon Sound goodies...more
author: Justin Meyers

title: New Tariffs Could Disrupt the Future of VR and AR: Here's Why
description: How will the new tariffs impact VR and AR? In short, they'll likely make headsets more expensive, slow down production, and force some serious changes in how these devices are made and sold. What you need to know: VR and tariffsNew tariffs are already active — The US raised tariffs on Chinese imports to 245%, and China responded with 84% tariffs on US goods. Most countries are affected, not just China. Headsets are about to get pricier — Components for VR/AR devices are heavily globalized, and tariffs will likely drive up production costs and retail prices. Mid-tier hardware is most at risk — Budget and premium devices may survive, but the $400–$800 segment could shrink or stall out. This week, the US raised tariffs on Chinese imports to 245%. This morning, China hit back with a 125% tariff on US goods. But this isn't just a geopolitical chess match — these moves are aimed squarely at the electronics supply chain, and that includes nearly everything inside your favorite immersive...more

title: Get Ready for a Game Changer in Your Entryway With This Storage Hack
description: Having enough storage in your entry area is critical if you don’t want to end up with piles of mess by your front door. Otherwise, coats, shoes, umbrellas, homework papers, keys, and random things collect on any nearby surface. Elena (@stilvoll.interior) decided to kick things up a notch when it came to their entryway, replacing their basic dresser with cabinets that maximized the vertical space.
